feed.title: TUoS HPC Changelog
feed.subtitle: Keep yourself up to date with recent changes on the University of Sheffield HPC clusters.

entry.title: Bessemer Slurm config change: enabled pre-emptable jobs

link.title: Bessemer Slurm config change: enabled pre-emptable jobs

entry.content:
Users can submit pre-emptable jobs to make use of idle CPUs and/or GPUs in private nodes in Bessemer. If the owners of those private nodes then submit jobs that require those resources to run then the pre-emptable jobs will be cancelled.

More information: https://docs.hpc.shef.ac.uk/en/latest/hpc/scheduler/index.html#pre-emptable-jobs
entry.summary: Users can submit pre-emptable jobs to make use of idle CPUs and/or GPUs in private nodes in Bessemer. If the owners of those private nodes then submit jobs that require those resources to run then the pre-emptable jobs will be cancelled.

entry.title: Software rebuild with gcc-10.1: CMake-3.17.1 & Make 4.3

link.title: Software rebuild with gcc-10.1: CMake-3.17.1 & Make 4.3

entry.content:
The softwares CMake & Make have been rebuilt using gcc-10.1 on ShARC. CMake & Make are build tools commonly used when compiling other libraries.

The documentation for the usage of this software can now be found at:

  • https://docs.hpc.shef.ac.uk/en/latest/sharc/software/development/cmake.html
entry.summary: The softwares CMake & Make have been rebuilt using gcc-10.1 on ShARC. CMake & Make are build tools commonly used when compiling other libraries.

entry.title: Major HPC documentation update: New file transfer guidance added!

link.title: Major HPC documentation update: New file transfer guidance added!

entry.content:
A major update to the HPC documentation has been made covering the process of making file transfers to or from the HPC clusters.

The new guidance can now be found at:

https://docs.hpc.shef.ac.uk/en/latest/hpc/transferring-files.html
entry.summary: A major update to the HPC documentation has been made covering the process of making file transfers to or from the HPC clusters.

entry.title: New software installed: NetLogo 6.2.0
entry.content:
The software NetLogo has been installed on Bessemer. NetLogo is a multi-agent programmable modeling environment. It is used by many hundreds of thousands of students, teachers, and researchers worldwide. It also powers HubNet participatory simulations. It is authored by Uri Wilensky and developed at the CCL.

The documentation for the usage of this software can now be found at:

  • https://docs.hpc.shef.ac.uk/en/latest/bessemer/software/apps/NetLogo.html
entry.summary: The software NetLogo has been installed on Bessemer. NetLogo is a multi-agent programmable modeling environment. It is used by many hundreds of thousands of students, teachers, and researchers worldwide. It also powers HubNet participatory simulations. It is authored by Uri Wilensky and developed at the CCL.

entry.title: Major HPC documentation update: New software installation guidance added!

link.title: Major HPC documentation update: New software installation guidance added!

entry.content:
A major update to the HPC documentation has been made covering the process of software installation on the HPC clusters from binaries and source.

The new guidance can now be found at:

https://docs.hpc.shef.ac.uk/en/latest/hpc/installing-software.html
entry.summary: A major update to the HPC documentation has been made covering the process of software installation on the HPC clusters from binaries and source.

entry.title: New software installed: ncdu 1.15.1
entry.content:
The software ncdu has been installed on Bessemer and ShARC: ncdu is a disk usage analyzer with an ncurses interface. It is designed to find space hogs on a remote server where you don’t have an entire graphical setup available.

The documentation for the usage of this software can now be found at:

  • https://docs.hpc.shef.ac.uk/en/latest/sharc/software/apps/ncdu.html
  • https://docs.hpc.shef.ac.uk/en/latest/bessemer/software/apps/ncdu.html
entry.summary: The software ncdu has been installed on Bessemer and ShARC: ncdu is a disk usage analyzer with an ncurses interface. It is designed to find space hogs on a remote server where you don’t have an entire graphical setup available.

entry.title: New software installed: Bowtie2 2.3.4.2
entry.content:
The software Bowtie2 has been installed on Bessemer. Bowtie2 is an ultrafast and memory-efficient tool for aligning sequencing reads to long reference sequences.

The documentation for the usage of this software can now be found at: https://docs.hpc.shef.ac.uk/en/latest/bessemer/software/apps/Bowtie2.html
entry.summary: The software Bowtie2 has been installed on Bessemer. Bowtie2 is an ultrafast and memory-efficient tool for aligning sequencing reads to long reference sequences.

entry.title: New software installed: STAR 2.7.6a
entry.content:
The software STAR (Spliced Transcripts Alignment to a Reference) has been installed on Bessemer. STAR is a software for RNA sequence alignment. STAR aligns RNA-seq reads to a reference genome using uncompressed suffix arrays.

The documentation for the usage of this software can now be found at: https://docs.hpc.shef.ac.uk/en/latest/bessemer/software/apps/STAR.html
entry.summary: The software STAR (Spliced Transcripts Alignment to a Reference) has been installed on Bessemer. STAR is a software for RNA sequence alignment. STAR aligns RNA-seq reads to a reference genome using uncompressed suffix arrays.

entry.title: Welcome to Changelog
entry.content: We have just launched this website. You will see HPC changelog updates here.
entry.summary: We have just launched this website. You will see HPC changelog updates here.
